sentences: James "Husalah" Ratliff (born April 13, 1979), is an American rapper from Pittsburg, California.
He began his career with the Pittsburg group the Mob Figaz, whose first album, C-Bo's Mob Figaz, was released in 1999.
Their first album, C-Bo's Mob Figaz, was released in 1999 and was a minor hit on the Billboard Hip Hop charts, entering in at #63.
His first solo album, entitled Dope, Guns, and Religion, was released in 2006 and was one of the most highly anticipated Bay Area hip-hop albums of the time.
"Lightweight Jammin'" (with E-40, & Clyde Carson on (Revenue Retrievin': Day Shift)
